SEARCH
Module edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager
Package edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager.models

Class Catalog

java.lang.Object
edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager.models.Catalog
public class Catalog extends Object
Represents a catalog containing a collection of products. This class implements the Singleton pattern.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Catalog getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the Catalog. If the instance doesn't exist, it creates a new Catalog and initializes the products list.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the Catalog.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all products from the catalog

    • getProduct

      public Product getProduct(String name)
      Retrieves a product from the catalog by its name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the product to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      the product identified by name.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the product is not contained in the catalog.

    • getAllProducts

      public List<Product> getAllProducts()
      Returns an immutable list of all products. Any attempt to modify the returned list will result in an UnsupportedOperationException.
      Returns:
      An immutable list of products.

    • contains

      public Boolean contains(String name)
      Checks if the catalog contains a product with the specified name. Prints the name being searched and the number of products in the catalog.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the product to search for.
      Returns:
      true if a product with the specified name exists in the catalog, false otherwise.

    • contains

      public Boolean contains(Product product)
      Checks if the catalog contains the specified product.
      Parameters:
      product - the product to search for in the catalog.
      Returns:
      true if the product exists in the catalog, false otherwise.

    • setAllProducts

      public void setAllProducts(List<Product> products)
      Sets the list of products for this instance. This method validates that all relationships between the provided products are correctly defined by calling the checkRTsRelations(List) method. It ensures that: - The products list is not null. - There are no duplicate products in the list. - All related products have a value val: between 0.0 and 1.0 - All related products are included in the provided list. - The total number of unique relationships matches the expected count.
      Parameters:
      products - the list of products to verify; must contain at least two products
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided list is null,if any relationship includes a product not in the given list, or if there are relations with values off bounds.
      IllegalStateException - if the number of unique relationships does not match the expected count for a fully connected set of products

    • createNewProduct

      public Product createNewProduct(String name, float price, ProductTemperature temperature, String imgPath, List<String> keyWords, List<Product> relatedProducts, List<Float> relatedValues)
      Creates a new product and adds it to the system if a product with the same name doesn't already exist.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the product to be created.
      price - The price of the product.
      temperature - The temperature category for the product (FROZEN, REFRIGERATED, AMBIENT).
      imgPath - The file path to the image representing the product.
      keyWords - A list of keywords associated with the product for easier search.
      relatedProducts - A list of related products that have a connection with this product.
      relatedValues - A list of float values representing the relationship strength with each related product.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If a product with the given name already exists in the system.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the size of relatedProducts or relatedValues does not match the number of products in the system.

    • eraseProduct

      public void eraseProduct(String productName)
      Removes the product with the specified name from the catalog.
      Parameters:
      productName - The name of the product to be removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If a product with the given name does not exist in the catalog.

    • modifyRelationProduct

      public void modifyRelationProduct(Product product1, Product product2, float relationValue)
      Modifies the relationship value between two specified products. If either product is null, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      product1 - the first product to modify the relation for.
      product2 - the second product to modify the relation with.
      relationValue - the new relationship value to set between the two products.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either product is null.

    • searchProduct

      public List<Product> searchProduct(String searchInput)
      Searches for products in the catalog based on the given search input. This method filters the list of products in the catalog by evaluating whether each product matches the provided search input. The filtering logic considers both the product's name and its associated keywords:
      • The product name is checked for case-insensitive containment of the search input.
      • The product's keywords are also checked, and a product is included in the results if any of its keywords (case-insensitively) contain the search input.
      The filtering process is case-insensitive to ensure user-friendly search behavior. For example, a search input of "apple" will match products with the name "Apple" or keywords such as "applesauce" or "red apple."
      Parameters:
      searchInput - the input string to search for (case-insensitive).
      Returns:
      a list of products that match the search input, either by name or by keywords.

    • getInfo

      public String getInfo()
      Returns a string with the information of the catalog. Including all products and their details.
      Returns:
      a string with the information of the catalog.
